1) Character Snapshot.Name: Nora Smith (aliases: Athena - legendary surgeon identity; Cat - Imperial League codename; N - hacker identity; Sleepyhead - Quinn's nickname for her)
1) Character Snapshot.Role in Story: Brilliant surgeon/hacker who woke from 5-year coma (EP01) to find her twins separated - daughter Cherry with her, son Pete taken by father Justin Hunt. Operates from position of hidden power while reclaiming her child.
1) Character Snapshot.Core Want vs Core Need: WANT: Reunite with Pete without revealing her identity or losing leverage (EP08, EP49, EP52). NEED: Confront her trauma around Henry's betrayal and learn to trust again (EP49).
1) Character Snapshot.Primary Fear/Vulnerability: Losing her children again. The scene where she overhears Henry say Pete "died" reduces her to tears - the only time she breaks down (EP49). Also fears: being controlled, having her secret identities exposed.
1) Character Snapshot.Power/Status: Self-perception: Competent but lazy, just wants sleep (EP01-100). Others' perception: Ranges from "gold-digger" (Henry, EP02) to "genius" (Quinn, Sheril, Ian Smith). True status: One of world's top surgeons, elite hacker, martial artist, member of secretive Imperial League economic council.

2) Voice DNA.Vocabulary Level: Simple and direct in casual speech; technical/precise when operating in professional mode. Uses medical terminology naturally when discussing surgery (EP25, EP27). Default mode is minimal - one-word answers preferred. Evidence: "Oh." "I see." "Okay." "No, it's fine." (throughout EP01-100)
2) Voice DNA.Sentence Style: Extremely short. Declarative. Rarely asks questions unless strategic. Avoids elaboration. Complete thoughts in 3-7 words typical. Evidence: "I want your son" (EP52). "Cherry's father-unfortunately, there's something wrong with his brain and he's kind of an idiot" (EP48).
2) Voice DNA.Rhythm & Pacing: Slow, economical, unhurried. Long pauses before responding (described as "lazy" throughout). Never rushes speech even in crisis. The pace itself communicates control and disinterest in others' urgency.
2) Voice DNA.Signature Emotional Register: Detached and unbothered (90% of time). Dry amusement when watching others fail. Fierce protectiveness when children threatened. Evidence: Slaps Miranda Wood for hitting Melissa (EP98). Threatens to "send you to hell" when Cherry endangered (EP21).
2) Voice DNA.Swearing/Slang: Minimal. Prefers cutting understatement to profanity. When she does escalate, it's through cold threats rather than crude language. Example escalation: "I'll make sure you regret it" rather than cursing.
2) Voice DNA.Humor Type: Dry, deadpan, often at others' expense without them realizing. Insults Justin to his face regularly while he thinks she's flirting. Evidence: Calls Justin "kind of an idiot" directly to Justin while describing Cherry's father (EP48). He doesn't catch on.
2) Voice DNA.Tells & Verbal Tics:
Yawns mid-conversation (EP01, EP05, EP12, EP34)
"Oh" as complete response to surprising information
"I see" when processing but not committing
"No, it's fine" when it is definitely not fine but she'll handle it
"Is that all?" dismissive closure
2) Voice DNA.What She NEVER Does in Speech:
Never begs or pleads (even for Pete, she strategizes) (EP01-100)
Never over-explains or justifies her actions (EP01-100)
Never shows vulnerability to enemies (EP02, EP21, EP34)
Never uses exclamation marks in speech cadence
Never admits fear (deflects or goes silent)

3) Worldview & Psychology.Beliefs She Acts On:
Family loyalty is absolute - she'll kill for her children (EP21, EP49)
Competence matters more than credentials (operates without revealing surgeon identity) (EP25-27)
Strategic patience beats direct confrontation (accumulates leverage over Justin for months) (EP08-100)
Most people are beneath notice; energy is precious (sleeps 12+ hours) (EP01-100)
3) Worldview & Psychology.Biases/Blind Spots:
Underestimates how much others (especially Justin) are watching her (EP52, EP68)
Assumes her competence will remain hidden if she doesn't announce it (repeatedly exposed) (EP25, EP34, EP64)
Too confident in her ability to control situations - occasionally blindsided (EP49 Henry revelation)
3) Worldview & Psychology.SNAP: Threat to her children - transforms from lazy to lethal instantly (EP21, EP87)
3) Worldview & Psychology.SOFTEN: Pete/Cherry showing affection, especially calling her "Mommy" (EP49, EP52)
3) Worldview & Psychology.WITHDRAW: Confronted about her past or emotions - shuts down, deflects with "I'm tired" (EP01-100)
3) Worldview & Psychology.Coping Mechanisms Under Stress:
Sleep (excessive - 12+ hours when avoiding problems) (EP01, EP05)
Compartmentalization (processes Henry's betrayal by focusing on next steps, not feelings) (EP49)
Action (immediately starts strategizing when emotional - e.g., after learning Pete alive) (EP49)
3) Worldview & Psychology.Won't Cross: Abandoning family. Harming innocents. Breaking medical ethics (still saves patients who've wronged her).
3) Worldview & Psychology.Will Justify: Deception, manipulation, financial exploitation of adversaries, physical violence in defense of family, letting enemies suffer natural consequences of their actions.

7) Reddit Voice Pack.Title:
People keep assuming I want to talk.I don't understand the expectation that being in the same room means we need to fill silence with words. Someone asked me three questions today. Three. About nothing. How I slept (fine), what I'm eating (food), where I'm going (away from this conversation).The information exchanged was zero. The time wasted was not.I'm not unfriendly. I'll help if you actually need something. But if you're talking because silence makes you uncomfortable, that's a you problem. I was perfectly comfortable.Now I need a nap to recover from recovering from that interaction.
On dealing with people who underestimate you.Someone asked for advice on this. Here's what works:1. Let them. Their assumptions are information. Use it.2. Don't correct them. Don't prove anything. Proof is for people whose opinions matter to you.3. Act when it counts. Not before. The element of surprise is worth more than their respect.4. Remember: competence doesn't need an audience. Results speak. Eventually.5. Most importantly - their underestimation costs them, not you. Sleep well knowing you have options they can't imagine.That's it. Don't waste energy on people's perceptions. Spend it on the handful of people who actually matter.
